tribute to Steve Wozniak

Steve Wozniak

Inventor, engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and entrepreneur.
Steve Wozniak presents his hopeful view on the popular cryptocurrency â€” Bitcoin.

Timeline of Wozniak's Life:

  • 1950 - Wozniak is born in San Jose, California on August 11th
  • 1968 - Wozniak graduates high school and attends University of Colorado. Eventually returns home due to high cost of tuition and its burden on his parents
  • 1971 - In his 3rd year, Wozniak takes a summer job at HP and attends Homebrew Computer Club in the meantime. This is where Wozniak meets Steve Jobs.
  • 1976 - Jobs convinces Wozniak to join him in starting their own computer company. They sell their valued possessions and build the first machine in Job's garage with the money. Woz marries Alice Robertson.
  • 1977 - With Wozniak working on the hardware and Jobs marketing, they introduce the Apple II. The Apple II was a revolutionary device as one of the first computers with a color display that provided a ready-to-tun programming language built-in.

    Wozniak has turmoils in his marriage with Alice Robertson. His obsession with computers consumes their relationship and they eventually divorce after four years of marriage.
  • 1980 - Woz and Jobs are slowly pushed out of power and Woz takes new hobby in flying. During flight, Woz unfortunately crashes and kills most on board but he manages to survive with some memory loss.
  • 1980 - Woz marries Candice Clark, a 1976 US Olympic gold medalist for canoeing in Montreal.
  • 1982 - Woz returns to the Apple II development team to work on what would later become the Lisa/Macintosh.
  • 1984 - Jobs reveals the Macintosh.
  • 1985 - Having conflicts with the Apple II team, Woz leaves Apple due to conflicting interests and beliefs.
  • 1987 - Woz files for divorce and his 7 year marriage with Candice Clark comes to an end.
  • 1990 - Woz marries Suzanna Mulkern, a former childhood friend, and now an attorney and a mother of three children.
  • 2000 - Woz receives the Heinz Award for technology, economy, and employment.
  • 2002 - Woz starts his own company, Wheel of Zeus (WoZ), specializing in wireless trackers to find locations of enabled objects.
  • 2004 - Suzanne Mulkern and Woz files for divorce after 14 years of marriage.
  • 2006 - Wheel of Zeus shuts down operations.
  • 2008 - Woz marries his long-term friend and Apple's Education Development Executive, Janet Hill.
  • 2014 - Woz joins SanDisk and is currently working as a Chief Scientist.
